solution_line_template: Roque takes {walk_time_one_way}*{walk_trips_per_week} = <<{walk_time_one_way}*{walk_trips_per_week}={walk_hours_to_work_per_week}>>{walk_hours_to_work_per_week} hours a week to walk to work.

Roque takes {walk_hours_to_work_per_week}*{trips_per_round_trip} = <<{walk_hours_to_work_per_week}*{trips_per_round_trip}={total_walk_hours_per_week}>>{total_walk_hours_per_week} hours a week to walk to and from work.
Roque takes {bike_time_one_way}*{bike_trips_per_week} = <<{bike_time_one_way}*{bike_trips_per_week}={bike_hours_to_work_per_week}>>{bike_hours_to_work_per_week} hours a week to bike to work.

Roque takes {bike_hours_to_work_per_week}*{trips_per_round_trip} = <<{bike_hours_to_work_per_week}*{trips_per_round_trip}={total_bike_hours_per_week}>>{total_bike_hours_per_week} hours a week to bike to and from work.

In total, Roque takes {total_walk_hours_per_week}+{total_bike_hours_per_week} = <<{total_walk_hours_per_week}+{total_bike_hours_per_week}={total_hours_per_week}>>{total_hours_per_week} hour a week to go to and from work.
